page.title: 04RELIGION, EAST BARKWITH
page.content: The religious buildings in the area are all Christian.{St. Mary's}church {East Barkwith}was originally Perpendicular in style, but underwent considerable restoration in the nine- teenth century. The pillars of the south aisle are obviously older than those on the north aisle. The font is octagonal,with carvings of heads and the instruments of the passion. The pulpit is metal, embossed with a pattern of grape vines.{St.Martin's} church,{South Willingham,}contains traces of thirteenth century work, but was also greatly restored in the nineteenth century. There is a squint, from the demolished north arcade, and a rood screen across the chancel arch. The reredos is of carved wood, with emblems of Matthew, Mark, Luke and John.
